title: Mary McSweeney
text:
I’m a data analyst passionate about transforming complex datasets into clear, actionable insights. I recently graduated from UCLA with a Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics & Data Science and a 3.90 GPA. Outside of solving analytical problems, I enjoy spending time crocheting and indoor bouldering.
View My Resume

title: Mary McSweeney
text:

title: Projects
text:
This portfolio highlights my data science and analytics projects across multiple domains — from sports forecasting to text mining and database design.
Each project demonstrates my ability to clean, analyze, and model complex data using Python, R, SQL, and Tableau to uncover actionable insights and communicate results visually and clearly.


MLB Pitcher Performance Forecasting
Goal: Predict MLB pitcher Wins Above Replacement (WAR) using multi-season data.
Highlights:
- Integrated pitch-by-pitch and game-level datasets across 15 seasons
- Built regression, decision tree, and XGBoost models to predict and forecast WAR
- Delivered feature-importance insights to MLB analysts on key pitcher metrics
Skills: R, Regression Modeling, XGBoost, Feature Engineering, Forecasting


Preview Report







Netflix Content Analysis
Goal: Explore trends in Netflix’s global content library.
Highlights:
- Cleaned and standardized 8,800+ titles using pandas and NumPy
- Visualized trends in release years, genre diversity, and content length
- Modeled content type (Movie vs. TV Show) using logistic regression
Skills: Python, pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, EDA, Data Visualization


Preview Report







Child Opportunity Index Analysis
Goal: Visualize educational inequities across California counties.
Highlights:
- Combined demographic and resource data to assess regional disparities
- Built interactive Tableau dashboards with filters and county-level comparisons
- Highlighted relationships between socioeconomic factors and opportunity levels
Skills: Tableau, Data Visualization, Dashboard Design, Spatial Analysis


Preview Report







Crochet Database and SQL Queries
Goal: Build a personal SQL database to organize crochet projects and materials.
Highlights:
- Designed a normalized relational schema with 6 linked tables
- Wrote advanced SQL queries (joins, CTEs, aggregations, window functions)
- Analyzed designer trends, yarn usage, and project timelines
Skills: SQL, SQLite, RSQLite, Database Design, Query Optimization


Preview Report







Predicting NBA Game Outcomes
Goal: Predict NBA game winners using statistical and contextual features.
Highlights:
- Engineered features for home advantage, win streaks, and opponent performance
- Compared classifiers (Logistic Regression, SVM, Random Forest, KNN)
- Achieved 64% mean accuracy with Logistic Regression
Skills: Python, scikit-learn, Feature Engineering, Model Evaluation


Preview Report







Song Lyrics Text Mining
Goal: Analyze lyrical and emotional changes in Billboard Top 100 songs from the 1960s–2010s.
Highlights:
- Cleaned and tokenized 6,500 songs using tidytext
- Performed sentiment analysis and topic modeling (LDA) by decade
- Built a Random Forest model to predict artist gender from lyrics
Skills: R, tidytext, Sentiment Analysis, Topic Modeling, Data Cleaning


Preview Report







Heart Disease Mortality Analysis
Goal: Identify key factors predicting mortality in heart disease patients.
Highlights:
- Conducted hypothesis tests and logistic regression on clinical data
- Found age, gender, cholesterol, and diabetes status as significant predictors
- Visualized relationships and tested for multicollinearity
Skills: R, Hypothesis Testing, Logistic Regression, EDA


Preview Report







Movie Score Prediction Model
Goal: Predict IMDb audience ratings based on movie characteristics.
Highlights:
- Modeled relationships between budget, gross revenue, and runtime
- Applied Box–Cox transformations to meet regression assumptions
- Evaluated model fit using residual and leverage diagnostics
Skills: R, Linear Regression, Model Selection, Box–Cox Transformation


Preview Report







Islanders Memory Study
Goal: Examine how dark chocolate and methamphetamine interact to affect memory.
Highlights:
- Designed a 2×2 factorial experiment with randomized groups
- Conducted two-way ANOVA and Tukey HSD post-hoc tests
- Found significant interaction effects between chocolate and methamphetamine
Skills: R, Experimental Design, Two-Way ANOVA, Statistical Testing


Preview Report
